alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Karnes, southern Atascosa and southeastern Wilson Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 814 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kosciusko to Campbellton to Cross. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenedy, Karnes City, Poth, Christine, Campbellton, Kosciusko, Runge, Falls City, Cestohowa, Coy City, Zunkerville, Paweleville, Choate, Fashing, Hobson, El Oso, Peggy, Helena, Deweesville and Pana Maria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
